message.content:
cs.CV, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.MM, cs.CR 

This paper is about person re-identification, which is a computer vision task. Therefore, cs.CV (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition) is the most likely sub-category. The paper proposes a novel unsupervised domain adaptation framework, which involves learning representations from labeled source domain and transferring them to the unlabeled target domain. This involves designing a domain adaptive attention model (DAAM) and a domain similarity loss, which are both related to machine learning and artificial intelligence, making cs.LG (Machine Learning) and cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) likely sub-categories as well. The proposed method is evaluated on two person re-identification benchmarks, Market-1501 and DukeMTMC-reID, which are related to multimedia (cs.MM) and cryptography and security (cs.CR), respectively. Therefore, these two sub-categories are also likely.
